channel.title: Line Rider
channel.description:
http://www.download3k.com/Install-Line-Rider.html An awesome... tool that is extremely addicting. (I called it a tool becuase you cant win or anything so its not a game.) Check out my thread for the hacked version: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,40511.0.html
Nope, if you know how to make Perfect lines watch this video: http://youtube.com/watch?v=SdsvOjSXyKU You don't need as many lines as the guy has in the video and once you get good at it the process goes quickyl. Refer to some of the jumps in my video for how much lines you need for a perfect curve depending on the speed.
-- Cheeesehunk

item.title: Line Rider
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I made new (better) one for strait lines. In this one, hold the right mouse button on the starting point, and release it on the ending point. And now F12 moves the screen according the the previous strait line (you need the normal-sized LineRider version to use this. Either the online version or the original .exe, not the one in this post).

Oh, and thanks for the perfect curve script. Less work for me

[scar]
program StraitLineRider;

var
x,y,x2,y2,x3,y3,Num,Hand,Pencil:integer;

begin
Hand := BitmapFromString(17, 14, ‘z78DAADD44B8EC3201004D02B’ +
‘8101034B1ACCFD8F1455150BA27C94CCA4DFC6B2932E7EF69CCFA’ +
‘B912FD4614432381CE8A9B1468660E01BB40073D02729FC57AF30’ +
‘E83145A5FBD213CCB7651E56CA09566124784CD1C875E734D0242’ +
‘E0F2F53D8F36029457D868795C295548A3AFB0867868BF4F4554A’ +
‘0FC03F790EE72A032C81FA2B8B5B11F694351EEEE039803FF7B3D’ +
‘09EC2558D155C8790204DF08EB83E79C27E4E6C925663824E45CB’ +
‘709732201AB84211D47F2FF5D7B55658F35DB3E3C951873841E76’ +
‘7A5D05DCAFBE2F2F904A982FAAF14AE86AE6B004EF15829193E4A’ +
‘D9B2DC459C3B5B56EDACEEC4003A45DD20B0F4D47D5B0DB878B64’ +
‘6AB35E7892D01F4FA69687F2BEDE07AADB7B7693D3D88A7C5FDA3’ +
‘D4B30DD0F7E768E07E5A3A6FDA5FD5194027E10701DA77BE23FAC’ +
‘2DC0089EF388B’);
Pencil := BitmapFromString(12, 15, ‘z78DAA5D2411244400C85E1’ +
‘2B25DDBAB134C8FD8F34F52716A69846C9B753EA495E313B9FBE4’ +
‘32A88271F41CD900E43853547560C056BC260C833C4A79D30CD90’ +
‘826D13D76788A14B68E7C43B456119A3A1548822BE75715145ECB’ +
‘00806A786B8B79D10BDE988936E3D2EFA6FE744C2D6ADE2D8ED52’ +
‘F02F611644B7EB88AD5B8126649FF626FE9BA44EE135E8B1DBD1E’ +
‘74EB755B1EF3665DCE976CBD9CF84B822E262DBC7398769777B91’ +
‘E397DAC3799FF093F322E10B764A0819’);

Num:=1;
ClearDebug;
repeat
repeat
wait(5)
until(IsMouseButtonDown(false) or IsFKeyDown(12))
if IsFKeyDown(12) = false then
begin
repeat
wait(5)
GetMousePos(x,y)
until(ismousebuttondown(false) or IsFKeyDown(12))
ClickMouse(x-1,y-1,true)
MoveMouse(x,y)
if Num > 1 then
begin
WriteLn(’’)
WriteLn(’’)
end;
WriteLn(IntToStr(Num) + ’ Got starting point (’ + IntToStr(x) + ', ’ + IntToStr(y) + ‘)’);

   repeat
         wait(5)
         GetMousePos(x2,y2)
   until(ismousebuttondown(false)=false)
   WriteLn(IntToStr(Num) + ' Got ending point, dragging mouse (' + IntToStr(x2) + ', ' + IntToStr(y2) + ')')
   Num:=Num+1;
   MoveMouse(x,y)
   HoldMouse(x,y,true)
   MoveMouse(x2,y2)
   ReleaseMouse(x2,y2,true)
  end;
  if IsFKeyDown(12) then
  begin
   //writeln('x, y = ' + IntToStr(x) + ', ' + IntToStr(y))
   //writeln('x2, y2 = ' + IntToStr(x2) + ', ' + IntToStr(y2))
   FindBitmap(Hand,x3,y3)
   MoveMouse(x3,y3)
   wait(5)
   ClickMouse(x3,y3,true)
   MoveMouse(x2,y2)
   HoldMouse(x2,y2,true)
   MoveMouse(x,y)
   ReleaseMouse(x,y,true)
   FindBitmap(Pencil,x3,y3)
   MoveMouse(x3,y3)
   wait(5)
   ClickMouse(x3,y3,true)
   MoveMouse(x,y)
   repeat wait(100) until(isfkeydown(12)=false)
  end;

until(false)
end.
[/scar]


Edit: Muahaha, I embedded my script into your script, = ownage

Read full topic

item.title: Line Rider
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Ok, here it is. First, set the Smoothness constant at the top ( The smoother the laggier ) and then select the client. Run the script, and then to draw a curve follow these steps:

Press F2 at the starting coords of the curve.
Press F2 at the ending coords of the curve.
Press F2 at the depth coords of the curve. ( This is how deep the curve will be, it takes a while to get used to where to position it. )
Press F2 to draw the curve.
Repeat

Also note, that during any pause, if you press F3, it will reset itself back to the first step, and if you press F5 during any pause, it will end the script.

Hope you guys like it,

-Weibs.

Read full topic

item.title: Line Rider
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Here’s a SCAR script for drawing strait lines (for anyone too lazy to make their own). Just press F12 on the starting point, and then press it again at the ending point.

[scar]
program StraitLineRider;

var
x,y,x2,y2,Num:integer;

begin
Num:=1;
ClearDebug;
repeat
repeat
wait(5)
GetMousePos(x,y)
until(isfkeydown(12))
if Num > 1 then
begin
WriteLn(’’)
WriteLn(’’)
end;
WriteLn(IntToStr(Num) + ’ Got starting point’);
repeat
wait(5)
until(isfkeydown(12)=false)
repeat
wait(5)
GetMousePos(x2,y2)
until(isfkeydown(12))
repeat
wait(5)
until(isfkeydown(12)=false)
WriteLn(IntToStr(Num) + ’ Got ending point, dragging mouse’)
Num:=Num+1;
MoveMouse(x,y)
HoldMouse(x,y,true)
MoveMouse(x2,y2)
ReleaseMouse(x2,y2,true)
until(false)
end.
[/scar]

Later I will try to make one that makes a perfect curve (the ones with like 50 lines). You would have to give it 3 points (start, center, and end).

Read full topic

item.title: Line Rider
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Weibs:

I know that, but if I exit out of it, the saved tracks are deleted.

I think they save in a file with the extension .sol It’s very hard to find sometimes, and I think when you save a track they all join the same file. Go to C:\Documents and Settings\Yourname\Application Data\Macromedia\Flash Player#SharedObjects\ There should be a folder with lots of numbers in there, click on it. Go to LocalHost. Then Documents and settings, click on your name. If its saved on your desktop, click desktop. Then LineRider_Beta.exe and the file should be in there.

My Directory: C:\Documents and Settings\Dave\Application Data\Macromedia\Flash Player#SharedObjects\AW7QGXMQ\localhost\Documents and Settings\Dave\Desktop\LineRider_beta.exe Your’s may be different, depending on where you saved it.

Read full topic
